quest.name: The Ul'dahn Envoy
journal: Raubahn means to entrust you with a task of the utmost import.

Appointing you his personal envoy, Raubahn bids you deliver a missive to the other two leaders of the Eorzean Alliance. In order to facilitate your journey, he bestows upon you an airship pass, which will allow you to travel by air between the three allied nations. Before making your way to the airship landing, be sure to quiz Momodi as to what awaits beyond the deserts of Thanalan.

In addition to Ul'dah, the Eorzean Alliance encompasses the city–states of Gridania and Limsa Lominsa. Once you have made your final preparations for the journey, take the Wellhead Lift to the airship landing and speak with Elyenora at the entrance lobby.
You are now ready to embark upon the first leg of your journey, which will take you to Limsa Lominsa. Make your way to the landing area and await departure.
Having safely arrived in Limsa Lominsa, you must now seek an audience with the Admiral. Ask the storm honor guard for assistance.
The Admiral awaits you in her command room on the Bridge. Take the Crow's Lift to Bulwark Hall, and present Raubahn's missive to Zanthael before the Admiral's Lift to gain admission.

Admiral Bloefhiswyn is receptive to the proposal detailed in Raubahn's missive. It appears the Garlean Empire still poses a grave threat to Eorzea, with the XIVth Imperial Legion, led by Legatus Gaius van Baelsar, deeply entrenched in the border regions. Your business in Limsa Lominsa successfully concluded, make your way to the airship landing and speak with L'nophlo.
You are now ready to embark upon the second leg of your journey, which will take you to Gridania. Make your way to the landing area and await departure.
Having safely arrived in Gridania, you must now seek an audience with the Elder Seedseer. Ask the serpent honor guard for assistance.
The Elder Seedseer awaits you at the Lotus Stand. Make your way to Nophica's Altar within Old Gridania, and present Raubahn's missive to the silent conjurer to gain admission.

Having now passed on Raubahn's message to the leaders of both Limsa Lominsa and Gridania, you have discharged your duty as the Flame General's envoy, and learned of the various threats facing Eorzea in the process. Given the immensity of the forces at work, you are moved to wonder what meaningful contribution a lone adventurer might make to the realm's preservation. Perhaps the answer will be revealed to you in the days to come.
objectives: Speak with Elyenora at the airship landing.
Speak with the storm honor guard.
Present Raubahn's missive to Zanthael at Bulwark Hall.
Speak with L'nophlo at the airship landing.
Speak with the serpent honor guard.
Present Raubahn's missive to the silent conjurer at Nophica's Altar.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Listen well, Forename. This will take some time to explain.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've prepared these letters for my counterparts in the Eorzean Alliance.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Five years ago, we looked on, powerless, as our brothers and sisters were taken from us at Carteneau─first by the Garleans, and then by the thrice-damned primal called forth by their treachery.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Not a day goes by that I do not think of my fallen comrades...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...And of the Warriors of Light, of whom no trace remained.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The tragedies of the Calamity are not so easily forgotten─nor should they be. In remembering all we've lost, we're reminded of what we still have.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And so I mean to mark the fifth anniversary of the Battle of Carteneau with a memorial service honoring the fallen.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: It is my hope that my counterparts in the Alliance will agree to do the same.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And I would have you bear my words to them as my personal envoy.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Why you? Because your deeds mark you out as the nearest thing I have to a Warrior of Light. I can think of none more worthy of the role. The question is: will you accept it?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Then it is agreed!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: You will journey to Gridania and Limsa Lominsa as my official representative.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Now, that's a great many malms to travel, but I've neither the time nor patience to wait around while you do it on foot.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I hereby grant you permission to use the airship routes connecting the three city–states. This pass serves as proof of your privilege.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Gone are the days when airship travel was available to all.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The ever-present threat of imperial attack has forced us to impose drastic restrictions out of concern for public safety.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: These passes are only granted when circumstance demands it─as in this case.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Though there were others who insisted you be granted one regardless.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Aye, Forename, I am not alone in seeing it...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Your potential is plain.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But I have said enough. In the name of the sultana, I bid you go forth.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: See for yourself the wonders of the realm for which the Warriors of Light risked all. Rise to your calling and fulfill your promise.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And should your path be barred by man or beast, strike fast and true, for victory belongs to the bold.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Now go, Forename, and heed the Crystal's guidance should you ever lose your way.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: See that those letters reach the Admiral and the Elder Seedseer, Forename. I would have all of Eorzea remember the fallen.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Ah! Back from your meetin' with Raubahn, are you? What did the big man have to say?

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Is that a fact!?

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Personal envoy of the Flame General himself!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: So you'll be bearin' the great man's words to the leaders of the Alliance, will you? And by airship! Bugger me...that's an honor and half, that is.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: ...But I can't think of anyone who deserves it more.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: I'm proud of you, Forename. I truly am.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Now, I daresay Raubahn told you this, but not many people get to go on airships, these days. In fact, most folk go to their graves havin' never once seen Eorzea from above...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Poor buggers shuffle off to meet Thal havin' never known the blues of Limsa Lominsa's shimmerin' seas, or the myriad greens of leafy Gridania...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: But not you, Forename. You'll see those sights and more, and everywhere you go, you'll find fascinatin' folk with fascinatin' tales to tell.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: The people you meet, the places you go─savor these experiences...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: For they are priceless, all.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Sayin' that, it'd be remiss of me if I didn't remind you to be careful out there.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Ul'dah ain't the only place beset by troubles, as you'll discover when you visit Limsa and Gridania.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Truth be told, that might well be exactly what the General wants you to realize. I think he knows what kind of womanman you are, Forename.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: And what kind's that, you ask? Why, the kind that can't resist stickin' herhis nose in other people's business, of course─and don't you ever go changin'!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Forename! I'll see you when you get back.

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. This is the reservation counter for passengers traveling to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: If I'm not mistaken, you are the Flame General's envoy, Forename Surname, yes? Highwind Skyways is at your service. Will you be flying with us today?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Should you change your mind, you need only speak to me, and I will see to it that you are assigned a place on the next airship.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Board the airship?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Do you wish to leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: We hope you have a pleasant voyage.

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: The airship bound for Limsa Lominsa will be departing shortly. Are you ready to board, madamsir?

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Thank you using Highwind Skyways. The airship bound for Gridania will be departing shortly.

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Very well. When you are ready to board, please let me know.

dialogue.name: ANNOUNCE
dialogue.text: Attention, all passengers: the airship bound for Limsa Lominsa is about to depart. Please make your way to the boarding gate.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: When first we met beneath the Sultantree, I sensed there was something unusual about herhim. I wonder if they will feel the same...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Godsspeed, Forename, godsspeed!

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: If I'm right, they'll be singin' your praises from here to the Farreach before long.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: May you always walk in the light of the Crystal...

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the envoy from Ul'dah! Welcome to Limsa Lominsa, madamsir. Admiral Bloefhiswyn awaits your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Please let me know if you require any assistance.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: You are the Ul'dahn envoy? Welcome to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: The Admiral has been looking forward to your arrival.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: Please proceed to the Crow's Lift at your earliest convenience. It will take you to Bulwark Hall.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: Once there, pray speak with Zanthael. He will be pleased to show you in to the Admiral's command room on the Bridge.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: Pray speak with Zanthael in Bulwark Hall. He will be pleased to show you in to the Admiral's command room on the Bridge.

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir, and welcome to our fair city. If you would permit me to examine the seal on the missive you carry...

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: Yes, everything seems to be in order. My apologies. We cannot afford to be complacent, you understand. Please, step this way.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: So the silver-tongued merchants send an adventurer to speak for them. It appears the Ul'dahns place great faith in you.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: This way.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I bid you welcome.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I am Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn, Admiral of Limsa Lominsa, and commander of the Maelstrom.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Now, what news from Thanalan?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Before you begin, I would know your name.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Strange. I would readily have sworn that I knew you, but it seems I was mistaken.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: If I cannot well recall the faces of my friends, I must trust in my ability to remember the faces of my enemies. Woe betide the Admiral who fails in that!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But I jest. Please, do continue.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Hm. A memorial service to honor the fallen.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Seven hells... Has it been five years?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Five years since the Garlean Empire sought to wrest Eorzea from our grasp...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: It was in answer to the imperial threat that the city–states formed the Grand Companies, and forged the Eorzean Alliance anew. But Garlemald was not content to wager all on a simple contest of martial might. They had other plans─the Meteor project.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Legatus Nael van Darnus─hells take him─intended to “cleanse” our realm by snatching the lesser moon, Dalamud, from the heavens and casting it down upon our heads. Desperate to prevent this lunatic scheme, we marched our forces to the Carteneau Flats and there met the VIIth Imperial Legion in battle.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Never have I seen a fight like the Battle of Carteneau─and I have seen full many.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But though we gave no quarter, spared not one onze of effort...we could not prevent what followed.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: From inside the shell of Dalamud came a winged nightmare─a dragon the size of a bloody city. 'Twas the elder primal Bahamut, bent on making an eighth hell of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: In the space of a breath, the legions of the Empire were set aflame, while our own armies fared little better. 'Twas as if the whole world was burning... Words cannot well describe the scene.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And yet...by some miracle, a few among us were spared.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Even as I steeled myself for death, a blinding white light enveloped me, robbing me of my senses.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: When I regained them, the dragon was gone, and the still-smoldering land was warped beyond all knowing.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Were Archon Louisoix still with us, he would doubtless shed some light on these unfathomable happenings. Alas, he is not, and I fear we will want for his wisdom in the days to come.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: For while our nations struggle to recover from the devastation, the beastmen call forth their damned primals to torment us anew.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Unless we put aside our differences and rebuild now, our foes will catch us unprepared.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And I speak not only of the beastmen. Do not imagine that the Empire has forsaken its claim on Eorzea. The imperials crowd our borders, waiting to strike.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Damn it all, we need champions to replace those we lost...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But such thoughts are worse than worthless. Time is short, and none will save us, save ourselves. It is the duty of every soul who survived the Calamity to work together for the good of Eorzea...and this memorial service may be the very thing to unite us.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye, Raubahn has the right of it. I accept his proposal.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Your duty is done here, adventurer─I will see to it that the Flame General receives my reply.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: You travel next to Gridania, yes?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Pray give my regards to the Elder Seedseer. Oh, and tell her the wolf has been sniffing around the stables. A private jest─and one in poor taste─but I would have you tell it all the same.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Fare you well, Forename. May the Navigator guide you on your journey.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. This is the counter for passengers traveling to Gridania.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: A pleasure to serve you again, madamsir. Are you ready to board the airship to Gridania?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Very well, madamsir. I'll be glad to assist you when you're ready.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Board the airship?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Do you wish to leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: We hope you have a pleasant voyage.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Are you ready to depart, madamsir? The airship bound for Gridania will be leaving shortly.

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Very well, madamsir. I'll be glad to assist you when you're ready.

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the envoy from Ul'dah! Welcome to Gridania, madamsir. The Elder Seedseer awaits your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Please let me know if you require any assistance.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: Greetings, good madamsir.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: You are the Ul'dahn envoy, are you not? I have received instructions to assist you.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: Pray make your way into the city proper, and identify yourself to the conjurer at Nophica's Altar. She will admit you to the Lotus Stand, where the Elder Seedseer awaits.

dialogue.name: SERPENT
dialogue.text: Pray make your way into the city proper, and identify yourself to the conjurer at Nophica's Altar. She will admit you to the Lotus Stand, where the Elder Seedseer awaits.

dialogue.name: MONK
dialogue.text: You are the Ul'dahn envoy? Begging your pardons, madamsir, but might I inspect the missive you bear?

dialogue.name: MONK
dialogue.text: Verily, this is the seal of the supreme commander of the Immortal Flames. Please come with me.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: So you are the Ul'dahn envoy.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: On behalf of our fair nation, I bid you welcome.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Please.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce myself.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I am Kan-E-Senna, Elder Seedseer of Gridania, and leader of the Order of the Twin Adder, our nation's Grand Company.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I understand you bear a message from the Flame General.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: But...before you begin, might I behold your face more closely?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: My apologies. It is just that you put me in mind of someone I once knew─a brave and noble soul.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: But come, let us return to the matter at hand.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: A remembrance service for the fallen of Carteneau...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Pray tell me, adventurer─what do you know of our conflict with the Empire?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: It would seem my counterparts recounted the tale in some detail. That is well.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Hm? A message from the Admiral? ...A wolf has been sniffing around her stables, you say? I see. Well, I shall be pleased to provide her with such counsel as I am able.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: But first, friend of my friend, I would tell you more of the Garlean threat.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: For the greater part of its history, Garlemald was not even among the most influential nations in Ilsabard, the northern continent. However, its innovations in the field of magitek, some fifty years past, helped to raise it from the depths of obscurity.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Emboldened by this technology, it set about subjugating its neighbors, swiftly absorbing each into its ever-expanding territory. And when all of Ilsabard lay within its grasp, it turned its ravenous gaze upon Eorzea.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet Garlemald's transformation did not come about by virtue of magitek alone. Its success owed much to the consummate leadership of its first and reigning emperor.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Solus zos Galvus─the man who built an empire in his own lifetime. Yet he has lived long, and after more than four score winters, it is said that he grows frail, and ever more prone to illness.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: If rumors are to be believed, the matter of succession has destabilized the imperial court. This would explain the Empire's relative inactivity in recent years, which has granted us much-needed time to rebuild.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet we cannot allow ourselves to become complacent, for Garlemald still maintains a presence in Eorzea, in the form of the XIVth Imperial Legion.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Commanding this great host is Legatus Gaius van Baelsar, a man whose ambitions are well known to us. So long as he breathes Eorzean air, none of us may sleep easy.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The Calamity wreaked such devastation upon the realm that it has been all we could do to nurse our wounds, never mind rebuild our defenses. Simply put, we have not the strength to repel the Empire.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: To add to our woes, the beast tribes continue to summon their primals, whose very existence is a bane upon the land.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Each nation is beset with its own primal problem; none has the resources to look beyond its own borders.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The Admiral desires my counsel regarding a brazen wolf.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: She means to tell me that the Empire may soon resume its advance.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Though the primals pose an undeniable threat to our survival, the threat posed by the Garleans is greater still. Clearly, each nation can no longer afford to think only of that which occurs within its own borders.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: A storm gathers upon the horizon. If we are to weather it, we must needs stand united once more. A remembrance service may help to rekindle the spirit of unity which brought the peoples of Eorzea together when last the Empire threatened our liberty.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The Flame General was wise to make his proposal, and I wholeheartedly approve of it. The necessary provisions shall be made for a service here in Gridania.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Your work here is done, my friend. I shall send my reply to the Flame General forthwith.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I thank you for coming. May the Twelve see you safely home.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now make use of the airship routes connecting the three nations. Before you may board an airship, you must pay the requisite fare in gil.
